cards.name: Oddish
cards.text: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Allergy Panic
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×4 instead.

cards.text: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

attacks.name: Pollen Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

cards.name: Bellossom
cards.text: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Colorless in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tangrowth
cards.text: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it's fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.

attacks.name: Hundred Furious Lashes
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. This Pokémon can't use Hundred Furious Lashes during your next turn.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

cards.name: Heracross
cards.text: No matter how heavy its opponents, it flings them far away with its prized horn.

attacks.name: Giga Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Celebi-EX

abilities.name: Time Recall
abilities.text: Each of your evolved Pokémon can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wind Whisk
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Snivy
cards.text: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

cards.name: Servine
cards.text: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

attacks.name: Double Slash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Serperior
cards.text: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

attacks.name: Double Slash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cottonee
cards.text: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

cards.name: Whimsicott
cards.text: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.

attacks.name: Fluffy Tag
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. During your next turn, the attacks of that Pokémon do 40 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Lilligant
cards.text: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

attacks.name: Draw In
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charizard
cards.text: It is said that Charizard's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Numel
cards.text: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees F. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Camerupt
cards.text: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years–or whenever it becomes really angry.

attacks.name: Fire Shard
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Victini
cards.text: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Relentless Flames
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Tepig
cards.text: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.

cards.name: Pignite
cards.text: Whatever it eats becomes fuel for the flame in its stomach. When it is angered, the intensity of the flame increases.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Emboar
cards.text: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Darumaka
cards.text: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 F.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Darmanitan
cards.text: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Damage Counterpunch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Squirtle

abilities.name: Shell Shield
abilities.text: As along as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: It shelters itself in its shell then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Wartortle
cards.text: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Deluge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: When headaches stimulate its brain cells, which are usually inactive, it can use a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Firefighting
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: When its forehead shines mysteriously, Golduck can use the full extent of its power.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. The Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aquafall
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Marill
cards.text: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it's fine even in rivers with strong currents.

cards.name: Azumarill
cards.text: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

attacks.name: Deep Dive
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Delibird
cards.text: It carries food all day long. When someone is lost in the mountains, it shares that food.

attacks.name: Present
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Oshawott
cards.text: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

cards.name: Dewott
cards.text: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

cards.name: Samurott
cards.text: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

attacks.name: Destructive Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Ducklett
cards.text: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

cards.name: Swanna
cards.text: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Defog
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Frillish
cards.text: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

cards.name: Jellicent

abilities.name: Stickiness
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each of your opponent's Pokémon in play is Colorless more.

cards.text: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Cryogonal
cards.text: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

attacks.name: Ice Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Keldeo
cards.text: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Keldeo
cards.text: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Keldeo-EX

abilities.name: Rush In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Secret Sword
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

attacks.name: Double Voltage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on contact.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.text: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.

attacks.name: Electriwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shock Wave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Chinchou
cards.text: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

attacks.name: Electripult
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Blitzle
cards.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

cards.name: Zebstrika
cards.text: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Wobbuffet
cards.text: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.

cards.name: Spoink
cards.text: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Grumpig
cards.text: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Duskull
cards.text: It loves the crying of children. It startles bad kids by passing through walls and making them cry.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Dusclops
cards.text: It seeks drifting will-o'-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

cards.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Sinister Hand
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

attacks.name: Shadow Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Toxicroak
cards.text: The croaking that Toxicroak produces before a battle is for churning the poison it has stored in its poison sac.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Cresselia-EX

abilities.name: Sparkling Particles
abilities.text: At any time between turns, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic Protection
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Munna

abilities.name: Long-Distance Hypnosis
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, your Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.text: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

cards.name: Musharna
cards.text: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Dream Waltz
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is Asleep. If this Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Woobat
cards.text: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Swoobat
cards.text: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.

attacks.name: Jet Woofer
attacks.text: For each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Venipede

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.text: Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey's location and state.

cards.name: Whirlipede

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), this Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.text: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.

cards.name: Scolipede

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), this Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.text: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

attacks.name: Destructive Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Meloetta
cards.text: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.text: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.

cards.name: Sandslash
cards.text: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.

attacks.name: Sand-Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gligar
cards.text: It clamps on to its chosen prey then jabs the stinger on its tail into the prey while it's stunned with surprise.

attacks.name: Wicked Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Gliscor
cards.text: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Night Slash
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Makuhita
cards.text: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

cards.name: Trapinch
cards.text: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

attacks.name: Smithereen Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Dwebble
cards.text: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Crustle

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

cards.text: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Mienfoo
cards.text: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Mienfoo
cards.text: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.

cards.name: Mienshao
cards.text: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Double Whip
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Landorus-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hammerhead
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Land's Judgment
attacks.text: You may discard all Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Assist
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Vullaby
cards.text: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.

cards.name: Mandibuzz
cards.text: It makes a nest out of the bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Scizor
cards.text: It raises its pincers with eyelike markings for intimidation. It also swings them down dangerously.

attacks.name: Steel Slash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speed of over 180 mph.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: Its heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Klink
cards.text: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Vibrava
cards.text: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sand Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Sand Slammer
abilities.text: At any time between turns, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: Known as "The Desert Spirit" this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

attacks.name: Flying Beatdown
attacks.text: You may discard a Grass Energy and a Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Black Kyurem
cards.text: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

attacks.name: Dual Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Flash Freeze
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Black Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freeze Shock
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: White Kyurem
cards.text: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

attacks.name: Damage Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Cold Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: White Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Stream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Burn
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: It searches for food all day. It gnaws on hard objects to wear down its fangs, which grow constantly during its lifetime.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Raticate
cards.text: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.

attacks.name: Gnaw Through
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.text: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

attacks.name: Hard Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: During your turn (before your attack), you may put a Basic Pokémon from your hand on top of this Pokémon. (This does not count as playing that Pokémon or evolving.) This Pokémon is now that Pokémon. (Any cards attached to this Pokémon, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.)

cards.text: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

cards.name: Snorlax
cards.text: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Togepi
cards.text: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

attacks.name: Attract Smack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Dunsparce
cards.text: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Taillow
cards.text: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

cards.name: Skitty
cards.text: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Delcatty
cards.text: The reason it does not have a nest is that it simply searches for a clean, comfortable place then sleeps there.

attacks.name: Gather Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Spinda
cards.text: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Buneary
cards.text: By extending its rolled up ears and striking the ground, it can bound so high it surprises itself.

cards.name: Lopunny
cards.text: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

attacks.name: Healing Melody
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

attacks.name: Patrol
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Lillipup
cards.text: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Herdier
cards.text: This very loyal Pokémon helps trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Stoutland

abilities.name: Sentinel
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand.

cards.text: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pidove
cards.text: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Tranquill
cards.text: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Unfezant
cards.text: Males swing the plumage on their heads to threaten others, but females are better at flying.

attacks.name: Wing Flick
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Audino

abilities.name: Busybody
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand, you may reveal it. If you do, heal 10 damage and remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon. Then, discard this Pokémon.

cards.text: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

attacks.name: Hip Bump
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Aspertia City Gym
cards.text: Each Colorless Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +20 HP.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Great Ball
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Hugh
cards.text: Each player either draws or discard cards until he or she has 5 cards in his or her hand. (Your opponent does this first.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rocky Helmet
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damage by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Skyla
cards.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Town Map
cards.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Computer Search
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Crystal Edge
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If this card is attached to White Kyurem-EX, each of its attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Crystal Wall
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If this card is attached to Black Kyurem-EX, its maximum HP is 300.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Gold Potion
cards.text: Heal 90 damage from your Active Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Celebi-EX

abilities.name: Time Recall
abilities.text: Each of your evolved Pokémon can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wind Whisk
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Keldeo-EX

abilities.name: Rush In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Secret Sword
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cresselia-EX

abilities.name: Sparkling Particles
abilities.text: At any time between turns, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic Protection
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Landorus-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hammerhead
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Land's Judgment
attacks.text: You may discard all Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Black Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freeze Shock
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: White Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Stream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Burn
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Bianca
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Cheren
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Skyla
cards.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Golurk
cards.text: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

attacks.name: Devolution Punch
attacks.text: Devolve the Defending Pokémon and put the highest Stage evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Ghost Hammer
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Terrakion
cards.text: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Fight Song
abilities.text: Your Dragon Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

cards.name: Rocky Helmet
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damage by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
